page.title: 20LOWER DARNFORD BEECH TREE
page.content: In the centre of the gathering of trees stands a Beech tree,with smooth grey bark.In the roots there is a water trap where gases float up.Lichen is growing on the tree and moss grows in the cracks.Around the other side is a{dead field mouse}we all think an owl caught it.By the water trap is an owl pellet and owl droppings.There are lots of insects living in and around the tree and spiders have spun webs in the cracks of the roots.We picked up a stone and found a{millipede}which was orange coloured.The girth of the tree was 3.75m and the longest root showing above ground was 6.20m.In the bark of the tree someone had carved 1853.
